content.description: In the center of the wall, climb cracks/arete/flares (5.9+ crux at the start, a bit grainy) in a protruding fin to a belay ledge 90' up. Pitch 2: climb the face to the right of the arete past flakes and huge knobs (5.8/9, bit runout), then join the easier arete (5.7 R) to the top (170').
content.protection: Gear, include slings for knob tie offs!
content.location: Middle of wall at the tallest section. Letter D in the topo.

content.description: Thin crack on small formation to left of main formation. Letter A in the topo.
Fun corner past a fixed piton on the left wall (about 20' up).
content.location: The corner on the right. Letter H in the topo.

content.description: Left side of the main buttress.
content.location: Start up the low-angle hand crack 30' right of the gully, then follow the most obvious cracks to the top. Letter C in the topo.

content.description: Roof crack. Letter B in the topo.
Sweet thin cracks, if it were 4 times the length it'd be a 5-star route!
content.location: Thin cracks on the right side of the crag. Letter I in the photo.

content.description: Cracks near the right arete of the low-angle face in the middle of the formation, leading to a ledge with fixed stopper anchor. Stoppers may be missing so bring your own (and a sling and rings/leaver carabiners). Possible to walk right from the anchor and keep climbing a second pitch up hand cracks and blocks.
content.protection: Gear, extra leaver stoppers if you want to rap.
content.location: Around to the left from the steep knobby wall. Letter E in the topo.

climbs.name: Chocolate Chips
climbs.fa: Dean Hobbs, Alan Roberts, Gary Slate, pre-'88

content.description:
The obvious steep wall with knobs, starting on the left then traversing right above the roof. One bolt about 2/3 of the way up the face. Fixed nuts anchor, possible to continue to the top as well. Letter F in the topo.

The direct start up the thin crack on the right side of the roof is 5.10d (letter G in the photo topo).
content.protection: Thin gear, one bolt. Fixed nuts at anchor.
content.location: Left side of the roof on the steep section of wall.
